comments.body:
@megies if the full test suit is "heavy weight" you might not want to run it here. (I am assuming you do run it in your CIs, right?)

Most of the time we are OK with simpler "is the package OK" kind of tests. Like imports and command line checks.

> In general I'm a bit paranoid 

I understand that and I am the same. If you can live with the way the tests are run now it is fine. Somehow I had the impression that you would need some extra workarounds.

PS: Travis-CI failure was due to a bad connection. I just re-started and it for you.

> If you can live with the way the tests are run now it is fine. 

Yes, works like a charm.

> Somehow I had the impression that you would need some extra workarounds.

No, it's fine. I can set an env variable in `run_tests.py` myself right before the tests are run and use it as a condition to skip the stray known fail in our test suite.

> PS: Travis-CI failure was due to a bad connection. I just re-started and it for you.

Yep, saw that. Thanks for restarting
